meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Hey there, fellow gamers! It's your buddy, the seasonal grok video game commentator, here to give you the lowdown on Reynatis. I'm not one of those fancy-pants critics who think they're above having a little fun or poking fun at themselves (cough, cough, TheGamer). So grab some popcorn, sit back, and let me share my two cents.

First off, we've got The Games Machine giving Reynatis a solid 75. They love the story, the combat system, and those massive boss battles with giant monsters! Unfortunately, exploring Tokyo and the parallel world of Another feels like a walking simulator (zing!). Still, it's an entertaining ride.

GamingTrend is closer to the mark, but still not entirely impressed. They give Reynatis 65, saying it nails the combat system but stumbles elsewhere - outdated graphics, poor Switch performance, awkward camera angles, and that whoppin' high price tag! (ouch!). On the bright side, they do have fond memories of some of its better moments.

TheSixthAxis is another critic who thinks Reynatis is a mixed bag. They give it 60, saying it's got heart like those old PS2 RPGs, but also lacks consistent execution. If you can look past that, they think the game's charm - strong character writing, living city of Shibuya, and angsty JRPG vibes - will resonate with you.

IGN Italia is more skeptical, giving Reynatis a meager 55. They say it fails to live up to its potential, with lackluster storytelling, underdeveloped characters, and repetitive combat mechanics. Yeah, sorry to hear that, IGN Italia!

God is a Geek and Noisy Pixel both give Reynatis a score of 50, saying it's an average experience. God is a Geek thinks it's not terrible, but just meh... Noisy Pixel says it combines cool world-building and fluid combat but stumbles in storytelling and gameplay depth.

And then there's TheGamer, who's having NONE of this game's business! They give Reynatis a whopping 20 and call it an "ugly, repetitive mess" with some of the worst writing ever. Ouch! Guess Yoko Shimomura and Kazushige Nojima must have had some bad days on set...

Overall, Reynatis is a weird beast - fun in some parts, cringeworthy in others. If you're looking for a unique combat system or an adventure with heart, it might be worth checking out. But if you're expecting perfection... well, let's just say the critics are mixed.

And that's my take on Reynatis! Hope you enjoyed the ride and didn't get too bogged down in the opinions. See you in the next review!
